node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: The clang of a blacksmith's hammer comes from the doorway of a stone building fronted with a large shoeing yard. A Gor'Tog farmer works at shoeing an ox suspended in a leather sling. The uncomfortable ox rolls its eye to look at you and lets out a protesting bellow.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: A willow-framed building with a thatched broom roof faces the path. Strutting proudly across the front of the house is a family of geese. The youngest stops to peck at something on the ground, until he is nudged onward by his elders. A carved signpost stands at the pathway.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: Clumps of bushes grow around a stone cottage topped with a roof thatched with heather. A night owl perches atop the cottage peering down at you, its white face luminous in the dark night. It lets out a single hoot, then flaps its wings and vanishes into the darkness.

Colorful flowers and bushes laden with berries grow in a wild, brilliant display around a stone cottage topped with a roof thatched with heather. A small grey donkey pokes its head out of the open doorway and gazes at you inquisitively.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: A wagon is parked alongside the pathway, banners flapping in the night breeze. It appears to be closed up for the night. You hear a faint snoring coming from within. Just beyond the village green to the south, you can see the glowing windows of a large building and the dark silhouette of a mill.

A colorful wagon is parked alongside the pathway, red and gold banners flapping in the breeze, the rippling cloth nearly drowning out a faint snoring coming from within. Clustered together at the nether end of the village are a small village green with an impressive manor house and an old mill just beyond it.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: From somewhere off to the south you can hear the rumble and splash of the miller's waterwheel. A straw thatched house is set off from the path with clay pots, bowls and urns displayed in its windows.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: A rickety wagon lurches past you, pulled by wide-horned oxen. A Gor'Tog wagoneer walking alongside the rumbling vehicle nods and tips his hat as he passes by. Clouds of dust eddy about the deep ruts left in the dirt roadway as the cart passes. A sturdy wood and stone building marks the local Trader's Guild outpost.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Village Green
node.description: The village green is filled with the night music of crickets and a lone owl who sits perched on a branch, hooting solemnly. A wooden bridge spans a dark crevice to the south.

Squeals and giggles come from a group of Gor'Tog children who are running around a small, blindfolded lad. The lad stumbles around, flailing his arms, trying to tag one of the others. A wooden bridge spans across a deep moat to the south, where a large manor house stands proudly overlooking the surrounding area. The village stocks are set off in the far corner of the green.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: A column of smoke spirals out of the tall stone chimney of a simple brick building. The dirt path to its door is trampled hard, and a delicious aroma wafts from the open doorway.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Churchyard
node.description: A neat line of flat white stones paves the pathway leading up to the door of an old church. A small cemetery has been set off in the churchyard, bordered by low hedges of lavender.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: The dirt pathway ends at a small toft fronting a cottage where candlelight shimmers from the windows. Dark, herbal-scented shrubs border the yard.

The dirt pathway ends at a small, neatly-kept toft that fronts a quaint cottage. Bees buzz industriously around the tall shrubs of sage, rosemary and nutmeg geranium that border the yard, attracted by their spicy herbal fragrance.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Old Mill
node.description: An old mill looks over the shoreline of the Segoltha River, its massive waterwheel splashing and churning the river's deep water. Tall grasses and willows grow abundantly around the mill grounds.

An old mill looks over the shoreline of the Segoltha River, its massive waterwheel splashing and churning the river's deep water. Tall grasses and willows grow abundantly around the mill grounds. Village women stand in groups collecting bundles of willow wands and grass.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Cottage Toft
node.description: Chickens, pigs and donkeys roam freely in the yard, penned in by the high shrubs that surround them. A quaint little stone cottage with a roof thatched with rushes sits at the far end of the toft. Bunches of herbs hang in its open windows. A purple lark hops back and forth along the roof's edge, eyeing you suspiciously. Perhaps it guards a nest up there in the rushes?

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Small Cottage
node.description: The scents of aromatic smoke and drying herbs hang in the air in this tidy one-room cottage. A tall drying cupboard stands against one wall, conveniently near the stone hearth. An odd assortment of vials, flasks and copper pots line the mantel. Bunches of herbs hang from wooden pegs mounted into the ceiling beams and window frames. The floor is beaten earth covered with fresh rushes. A stooped old woman works a set of bellows, keeping the hearth's fire going at full blast.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Dirt Pathway
node.description: A river-rock wall extends east to west, protecting the northern end of a rambling village. The open village gate looks out across a vast stretch of the fields worked by the villagers. A dirt pathway winds southward through a collection of cottages, shops and huts standing at odd angles, most with a fence or ditch fronting the path. Farmers, returning from a day in the fields, find fellowship and food in the conveniently-located pub, The Pig's Pannage, its open doors just a short walk from the gate.

node.name: Grassland Path, Village Gate
node.description: A long rock wall extends east and west bordered by the grassland path. Beyond the wall you can make out the thatched rooftops of the village homesteads. The massive village gate stands open, its wooden beams painted with colorful gold and black stripes.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Pub
node.description: A huge black and gold banner dominates the wall behind a massive stone bar. Several Gor'Tog farmers are huddled together at one end, muttering to each other in low, rumbling voices. Gurta, the alewife, slams a tankard on the bar and sends it sailing down to the farmers. A platter of bacon and beans follows the tankard.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Alcove
node.description: A booth with a wooden table and benches is tucked into the alcove, offering a quieter spot for private conversation. Occasionally the loud thunk of a metal tankard being slammed onto the bar makes you aware of the activities in the central part of the pub.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Havor's Forge
node.description: The smell of hot iron assails you as you enter the domain of Havor, the Gor'Tog blacksmith. A massive anvil and stone forge stand side by side on the hard dirt floor, and tools of the blacksmith's craft lay neatly arranged on a wooden bench. Several grinding wheels and a bin holding lengths of iron make up the rest of Havor's shop.

node.name: Sazu's Cottage, Byre
node.description: A mule brays in surprise as you enter his domain, and several chickens flap their wings, annoyed at the intrusion. Mounds of hay and nesting shelves provide sleeping places for the occupants. A deep ditch separates the byre from the living area to the south, and a narrow wooden ramp provides access.

node.name: Sazu's Cottage, Dyeing Chamber
node.description: Sazu, the Gor'Tog dyer, stands at a black iron kettle, stirring the liquid within. She reaches up to grab a handful of berries from an overhead basket, and tosses them into the pot. Dozens of wicker baskets hang from the ceiling, along with bunches of drying flowers. Unglazed windows have their shutters opened to let in the daytime breezes. A dye menu chart is nailed next to a ladder which appears to lead to a room overhead.

Sazu, the Gor'Tog dyer, works industriously at a table, pounding dried flowers into a fine powder. She tosses the colorful powder into a black iron kettle, and stirs the liquid within. Dozens of wicker baskets hang from the ceiling, along with bunches of the drying flowers. The cottage windows are shuttered tightly against the night air. A dye menu chart is nailed next to a ladder which appears to lead to a room overhead.

node.name: Sazu's Cottage, Sleeping Loft
node.description: A simple straw pallet is the only furnishing here, but the loft has been festively decorated with bunches of lavender heather in earthenware pots and colorfully dyed garments hanging from wall pegs.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Peddler's Wagon
node.description: Every inch of this roomy covered wagon has been used efficently to store an amazing array of trinkets, colorful clothing and carryalls. The peddler Posimur reclines against the back of the wagon half asleep midst a pile of discarded cloth, leather and string.

node.name: Tiger Clan, Trader's Guild Outpost
node.description: This outpost is a replica of the great Trader Guild buildings in the larger towns. Designed for easy buying and selling of bulk goods by Guild members, it is crammed and jammed with crates, boxes and packages of all manner and value. A worried-looking Guild trade minister is at hand to expedite transactions and to make sure none of the goods leave without the proper fees and monies being exchanged.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Communal Ovens
node.description: A massive brick and iron oven fills the small shop, leaving barely enough space for the portly baxter Fernar, who stands behind a narrow wooden counter. The delicious aroma of baking bread emanates from the oven, along with waves of intense heat. The bulky Gor'Tog removes a tray of plump buns, and squirms back around to place them on the countertop. A village woman enters the shop, hands Fernar a bowl of rising dough with brisk instructions, then lumbers purposefully out the door.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Cottage Croft
node.description: The croft behind the stone cottage is a bountiful herb garden overflowing with clumps of hyssop, angelica, liverwort, monkshood and sweet woodruff. The abundant growth partially obscures a stone birdbath where a family of purple larks sit, sipping at the water and cheerfully chirping to each other.
Heady herbal scents rise from the dark clumps that fill the croft garden. A stone birdbath sits silent and still in the center of the garden.

node.name: Manor House, Courtyard
node.description: A group of ducks waddles past the wooden moat bridge, quacking loudly to each other. An enormous manor house and its surrounding buildings are sprawled across the southern end of the village, hugging the shoreline of the Segoltha River. The impressive appearance of the house is somewhat marred by a large freckled pig that lays sound asleep next to the massive hardwood door.

Candlelight twinkles from the many windows of an enormous manor house that is sprawled across the southern end of the village, hugging the shoreline of the Segoltha River. The low sound of snoring comes from the house, and you notice a large pig laying sound asleep next to the massive hardwood door.

node.name: Manor House, Orchard
node.description: A grove of trees covered with deep green, glossy leaves and laden with plump fuzzy peaches stands just east of a large manor house. A cobblestone path winds through the trees toward a group of buildings to the south.

node.name: Manor House, Pathway
node.description: A Gor'Tog housemaid emerges from a stone building carrying a huge silver platter of roasted meat. She hurries it through a side door of the manor house. Opposite the stone building is a brick structure with neatly-trimmed rosemary and lavender hedges surrounding it. Several women in servant's garb hang freshly washed garments and linen on the hedges to dry.

node.name: Manor House, Pathway
node.description: A strong, unpleasant odor comes from a stone-block building where bits of bones and brownish stains cover the entryway. Dozens of flies buzz and crawl over the strong mesh covering the building's window.

node.name: Manor House, Game Larder
node.description: The unmistakable odor of putrefying meat assails you when you enter the larder, lessened only slightly by the breeze flowing through the mesh-covered windows that are arranged all around the building. A large iron wheel mounted in the ceiling supports several slabs of meat and carcasses of game birds. Brine barrels and salting tubs are placed alongside a stone chopping block.

node.name: Manor House, Kitchen
node.description: The tantalizing aroma of roasting meat and herbs emanates from a massive brick hearth on the far wall. An iron spit revolves slowing over the fire, powered by a strange contraption. Sitting conveniently at the hearthside are a tinderbox and a huge wooden bin. Shelves on the walls are covered with neatly arranged supplies, and sturdy wooden pegs mounted in the beams of the high vaulted ceiling hold hanging bunches of garlic and onions. A long deal table occupies the center of the stone floor.

node.name: Manor House, Washhouse
node.description: Enormous coopered tubs fill the room, some filled with clothes soaking in soap-filmed water. Several washboards and an assortment of wash-sticks hang from the wall. An earthenware soapdish holds a few greyish lye-balls.

node.name: Manor House, Hallway
node.description: This short hallway contains a wooden entryway leading out to the curia on the west side and a servant's door on the east. A young serving girl comes through the door, carrying a covered platter toward the buttery to the north.

node.name: Manor House, Buttery
node.description: Dishes and cups are arranged in piles and stacks atop wooden shelves that line the walls. A Gor'Tog girl dressed in servant's garb stands at a slopstone, her hands emersed in a large metal washtub scrubbing crockery in sudsy water.
Dishes and cups are arranged in piles and stacks atop wooden shelves that line the walls. Loaves of fresh baked bread wrapped in clean cloths are lined up on a table, awaiting the morning meal.

node.name: Manor House, Dry Larder
node.description: The west wall of the larder is covered with an enormous blue cupboard, while the east wall holds an equally large purple cupboard. Birdcages containing blackbirds, larks, plovers and thrushes hang from the ceiling among muslin bags of drying herbs.

node.name: Manor House, Wet Larder
node.description: This dimly-lit larder is cool and damp. A light breeze wafts in from mesh-covered windows, easing the strong fishy smell that hangs in the air. The brick floor slopes downward toward a drainage hole in the center. Thick slate shelves contain fresh fish, cuts of meat and vegetables covered with muslin and handfuls of wet rushes.

node.name: Manor House, Servant's Passage
node.description: This cramped passageway connects the servant's areas. Some stone stairs lead down to the manor's ale cellar.

node.name: Manor House, Servant's Passage
node.description: The clanking of iron comes from a wooden door, as a weary-looking Gor'tog maid passes through it, heading up some rickety steps for a much-needed break.

node.name: Manor House, Dining Hall
node.description: The heavy blue velvet drapes that cover the many windows in the room are trimmed with shiny gold fringe. A long mahogany dining table is surrounded by highback chairs, with a large throne-like chair occupying the master's place at the head of the table. A massive sideboard runs the length of one wall, its surface laden with food.

node.name: Manor House, Hallway
node.description: A Gor'Tog dressed in servant's garb drags a leashed goat out of a wood-framed opening in the south wall. The animal, stubbornly munching on a candlestick, tosses its head in irritation as it follows the man. Delicious aromas of roasted meat waft through a wooden arch to the west.

node.name: Manor House, Vestibule
node.description: The high-ceilinged vestibule leads from the manor's entry to an ornately carved wooden archway that opens out to the central courtyard. Tiers of purple velvet with gold fringe top the vestibule and connecting passageway walls, adding a garish touch to the otherwise attractive room.

node.name: Manor House, Corridor
node.description: The walls topped with tiers of purple velvet continue down the east-west stretch of corridor. A Gor'Tog housemaid, wielding a broom, chases an angrily clucking chicken around a bend to the south.

node.name: Manor House, Corridor
node.description: Several prosperous-looking Halfling traders emerge from an iron door, stepping aside gingerly to avoid a mother pig who has chosen a central spot on the corridor floor to nurse her young. They chuckle to each other about the hazards of finding good caravan guards these days, as they head north.

node.name: Manor House, Corridor
node.description: The corridor ends at an enormous purple door that fills most of the south wall. A smaller blue door leads to the west. This end of the hall seems much quieter, with not a pig or chicken in sight.

node.name: Manor House, Cloak Room
node.description: Several cloaks and greatcoats belonging to the manor's guests hang on wooden coatracks. A collection of muddied boots have been tossed in a discarded jumble in a dark corner.

node.name: Manor House, Library
node.description: Impressive acanth wood bookshelves line the walls here. Several books reside on the shelves, but most are heaped in a pile on the floor. A young goat stands over them, contentedly munching on some pages.

node.name: Manor House, Drawing Room
node.description: This richly, but rather garishly furnished drawing room contains an ancient central hearth where a hearty fire crackles. Vivid purple and blue flowers cover the long couches and chairs, and equally bright matching flowers spread across the carpeted floor. The furniture has a dusty appearance, as if the room has been unused for awhile.

node.name: Manor House, Ortug's Study
node.description: Chaos rules in this unorganized jumble that Ortug calls a study. Unsteady piles of papers and books cover the floor and desk, forming the Grandmaster's preferred filing system. A brown and white feathered chicken makes her way through the maze of stacks, squawking and flapping her wings when a single paper drifts down from the desk, sailing over her head and onto the floor.

node.name: Manor House, Guardroom
node.description: The Grandmaster Ortug lumbers slowly around a group of Gor'Tog guards, proudly examining their bright purple uniforms. The guards listen carefully as Ortug instructs them. He recites, Some person mess with caravan, you bash them! Some critter mess with caravan, you bash it! Several of the guards nod thoughtfully, while another carefully scratches a reminder note on a crumpled piece of paper.

node.name: Manor House, Bedroom
node.description: This small bedroom belongs to the family's son, Grob, who is sitting on the floor studying something. He quickly shoves a piece of paper under the bed, giving you a furtive glance. Toy war clubs and shields are strewn around the room, and a small version of the Tiger Clan guard uniform hangs from a peg on the wall.

node.name: Manor House, Master Bedroom
node.description: The Borthgar master bedroom is a visual disaster! The purple paisley bed quilt clashes with the red floral rugs and blue checquered draperies. Resomba, the manor mistress, sits in a massive rocking chair trying to do some embroidery. She glowers at her work and impatiently yanks out some stitching, ripping the fabric in the process.

node.name: Manor House, Curia
node.description: This open-air courtyard is bustling with activity. Young Gor'Tog housemaids giggle and laugh together as they sit in the shade, peeling vegetables for the evening meal. Occasionally, they gaze admiringly at several sweating, muscular guards who are training with hefty iron clubs. The clang of iron against iron fills the air. A large archway leads into the main part of the manor.

The clang of iron against iron jars the peaceful night in this open-air courtyard. Two young men from Ortug's team of guards train with massive metal clubs. The sweat on their hefty Gor'Tog arms glimmers in the dim light from their candles. A large archway leads into the main part of the manor.

node.name: Manor House, Linen Closet
node.description: A large fitted cupboard takes up most of the space in the little linen closet. A wooden mending table, set off to the side, holds a frayed monogrammed sheet with a threaded needle still stuck in it.

node.name: Manor House, Ale Cellar
node.description: A massive copper dominates the cellar room. Ale barrels stand in rows on the sawdust-strewn cobbled floor. A Gor'Tog woman, her head covered by a purple kerchief, uses a wooden paddle to stir some malt into the liquid held in a large mash tun. A shelf holds casks of yeast and tubs of malt. By the foot of the stairs, a wincing elderly Gor'Tog man holds a stringy wig between two fingertips as if he were disposing of a dead rat.

node.name: Manor House, Servants' Quarters
node.description: This large attic room holds several curtained bedsteads that are tucked into the eaves of the manor roof. Short stools and a single table holding a metal wash basin are the only other furnishings here.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Old Church
node.description: Some rows of wooden pews are set before a simple altar. A symbol carved in the shape of a dove rests on a dais, and a quiet peace fills the space in tribute to Albreda's blessing. Light filters through a high window with dust motes dancing in the tranquil beams.

Some rows of wooden pews are set before a simple altar. A symbol carved in the shape of a dove rests on a dais, and a quiet peace fills the space in tribute to Albreda's blessing. Candlelight casts a tranquil glow over the walls and pews and gives the space a safe and warm feeling at any hour of the night.

node.name: Old Church, Belfry
node.description: The ivory-colored balustrade surrounding the belfry is carved with stylized representations of birds and animals. The view below is of the church cemetery to the north, and the village green off to the west.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Cemetery
node.description: The final resting places of individuals and entire families are marked with carved stones. The history of the village is written in the epitaphs. A tiny mound of freshly turned earth covered with flowers gives testimony to the continuing function of the cemetery in the cycle of life and death.

node.name: Tiger Clan Home, Cemetery
node.description: The headstones here are plainer and newer than the section of the cemetery closest to the church. A lavender hedge separates the sacred ground from the surrounding countryside, with a Halfling-high stone wall stretching across the northern boundary.

node.name: A Dark Gap
node.description: Cold, clammy, damp dark surrounds everything. An odor of decay permeates the stale air.

node.name: Underground, A Dark Cavern
node.description: A large cavern, with passages excavated in several directions, drips with ooze and foul decay. The ground is slippery with mud and the walls and floor appear to pulse and shift, as if this were the belly of some sluggishly digesting beast.

node.name: Tiger Clan, Grassy Trail
node.description: Along a trail lined with willows, the smells of soggy grass, dead fish and peat moss permeate the atmosphere. The bubbling and splashing of the nearby river overpower the usual sounds of the wilderness, causing the shadowed areas of the trees and tall grasses to seem almost menacing in their silence.

Along a trail lined with willows, the smells of soggy grass, dead fish and peat moss permeate the atmosphere. The bubbling and splashing of the nearby river overpower the usual sounds of the night, the looming trees giving cover to all manner of creatures within the depths of their shadows.

node.name: Manor House, Lamp Room
node.description: Dozens of long tapered candles hang from pegs on the walls, while a row of oil lanterns spans the top of a long wooden cabinet.

node.name: Togball Field, Sideline
node.description: A thick covering of uneven grass is interrupted here and there by several thick tree stumps that have been sawed off at just the right height to comfortably fit a pair of typical 'Tog buttocks. Along the edge of the field of play stands a thick wooden pole with a goblin skull mounted on the top.

node.name: Togball Field, Visitors' Bench
node.description: Most of the ground has been reduced to bare dirt by the passage of many heavy feet. An occasional hardy clump of turf manages to survive, dotting the dull brown with spots of green. Dominating the area is a huge log that has been split lengthwise and laid parallel to the field, clearly intended as a bench. At either end of the bench is a large water barrel. A wolf skull on a thick wooden pole stands along the edge of the field of play.

node.name: Togball Field, Spectators' Grandstand
node.description: A tall wooden grandstand, composed of tiers of stout oaken planks, rises above the sideline, providing a prime view of the action near midfield. Bits of old food, scraps of torn pennants, and other assorted detritus litter the ground underneath and the well-trampled mud and grass alongside. An ogre skull on a thick wooden pole stands along the edge of the field of play.

node.name: Togball Field, Home Team Bench
node.description: The passage of many heavy feet has reduced the ground to bare dirt. An occasional hardy clump of turf manages to survive, dotting the dull brown with spots of green. Dominating the area is a huge log that has been split lengthwise and laid parallel to the field, clearly intended as a bench. At either end of the bench is a large water barrel with a large bronze tiger emblem bolted to it. A cougar skull on a thick wooden pole stands along the edge of the field of play.

node.name: Togball Field, Sideline
node.description: Apparently the dumping ground for stones cleared from the field proper, this area is littered with a variety of large rocks. Many of them look suitable for sitting on with a fair view of the field, although some appear to be uncomfortably pointy or jagged. A hog skull on a thick wooden pole stands along the edge of the field of play.

node.name: Togball Field, Ball Holding Pen
node.description: A large steel pen sits amid the uncut grass. A pair of guards in Tiger Clan livery sit dozing in front of the gate. The cage rattles slightly as they snore.

A large steel pen sits amid the uncut grass. A pair of bored-looking guards in Tiger Clan livery sit in front of the gate playing Rock, Paper, Scissors. Both appear to be choosing Rock repeatedly, and they scratch their heads in agitation.

node.name: Togball Field, Snack Area
node.description: This small square of scraggly turf is littered with discarded mugs and bits of dropped foodstuffs. Beneath a pair of gnarled oak trees is a rickety lean-to.

node.name: Togball Field, Orange Attack Zone South
node.description: Scraggly clumps of turf are interspersed with bare patches of dirt. A goblin skull on a stout blue pole marks the area.

node.name: Togball Field, Behind the Goal Line
node.description: There is little here other than a patchy covering of grass. To the east is the field of play. A stout log fence runs along the southern and western sides to prevent the attempted escape of panicked balls.

node.name: Togball Field, Orange Half-Forward South
node.description: Scraggly clumps of turf are interspersed with bare patches of dirt. A wolf skull on a stout blue pole marks the area.

node.name: Togball Field, Midfield South
node.description: Scraggly clumps of turf are interspersed with bare patches of dirt. An ogre skull on a stout blue pole marks the area.

node.name: Togball Field, Black Half-Forward South
node.description: Scraggly clumps of turf are interspersed with bare patches of dirt. A cougar skull on a stout blue pole marks the area.

node.name: Togball Field, Black Attack Zone South
node.description: Scraggly clumps of turf are interspersed with bare patches of dirt. A hog skull on a stout blue pole marks the area.

node.name: Togball Field, Behind the Goal Line
node.description: There is little here other than a patchy covering of grass. To the west is the field of play. A stout log fence runs along the southern and eastern sides to prevent the attempted escape of panicked balls.

node.name: Togball Field, Behind the Goal
node.description: A stout log fence runs along the western edge of this area. To the east are two thick orange logs embedded upright in the ground to serve as goalposts.

node.name: Togball Field, Behind the Goal Line
node.description: There is little here other than a patchy covering of grass. To the east is the field of play. A stout log fence runs along the northern and western sides to prevent the attempted escape of panicked balls.

node.name: Togball Field, Orange Attack Zone North

node.name: Togball Field, Behind the Goal
node.description: A stout log fence runs along the eastern edge of this area. To the west are two thick black logs embedded upright in the ground to serve as goalposts.

node.name: Togball Field, Black Blood Zone
node.description: This part of the field is marred by numerous divots, leaving only a few hardy patches of grass undisturbed. Two thick black logs are embedded upright in the ground on the east side, forming the goal. On the west end is a stout red pole with a hog skull on top of it, signifying the edge of the Blood Zone.

node.name: Togball Field, Black Half-Forward Center
node.description: Scraggly clumps of turf are interspersed with bare patches of dirt. A faint track with no grass at all runs east-west down the center, likely the result of numerous 'Togs attempting to take the most direct route toward the goal. A cougar skull on a stout red pole marks the area.

node.name: Togball Field, Midfield
node.description: This section of the field is virtually all dirt with almost no grass in evidence. There is a small crater in the center, where countless scrambles for the ball have occurred. A stout red pole with an ogre skull on it marks the area as Midfield.

node.name: Manor House, Poultry Yard
node.description: The gentle fluttering of wings and occasional cooing come from the dark huddled shadows of sleeping birds. A stone dairy and great barn overlook the yard, and some wooden steps lead down toward the Segoltha River's edge.

node.name: Manor House, Dairy
node.description: The gurgle of trickling water resounds pleasantly in the peaceful tranquility of this ceramic-tiled room. Slate shelves trimmed with marble edge the walls, providing a cool surface for the flat pans of separating milk. A Gor'tog dairymaid wielding a pair of grooved wooden batlets deftly shapes a portion of butter, then adds a decorative Tiger imprint with a butter stamp.

node.name: Manor House, Caravan Barn
node.description: The soft lowing of cattle mingles with the more strident sounds of yaks and mules being unharnessed by strapping Gor'Togs. A similiar group can be spied through the stable door, swiftly unloading caravans and pack animals. Tired traders troop towards the manor house and a meal, passing beneath a large painted sign.

node.name: Manor House, Waterfront
node.description: The deep waters of the mighty Segoltha River lap against the wooden planks of the Grandmaster's boats that are securely tied at the shore. Across the river and far off to the south, you can see the treetops of the massive Endrus Forest.

node.name: Smash 'Em, Handle with Care
node.description: The cotton sides are pulled back and tied to the support poles, giving the area an open feeling and allowing any breezes to come through. Along the back of the makeshift room two sturdy wooden pens hold an assortment of togballs while two flanking tables display the cases to hold them. A huge arrow painted bright yellow points the way out.

node.name: Smash 'Em, Something to Wear
node.description: The cotton sides are pulled back and tied to the support poles, giving the area and open feeling and allowing any breezes to come through. Along one side are two racks holding an array of neatly hung jerseys while a pair of shelves sit across from them displaying a collection of togball boots.

node.name: Smash 'Em, Bash 'Em
node.description: The cotton sides are pulled back and tied to the support poles, giving the area and open feeling and allowing any breezes to come through. A pair of large wooden bins sit square in the middle of the room.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Garb
node.description: A fine array of clothing hung on racks and hooks surrounds the area, appearing to be separated by sizes. Along the eastern wall, brightly colored signs denote a Gor'Tog section, and the opposing wall hosts a simple sign that seems to be marked with a great deal of scribbles and small stick figures.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Games
node.description: This part of the tent is set up much like a play area, featuring a wide space to allow patrons to challenge each other and pick over a few sport-related goods. A nearby cart laden with food and drinks provides refreshment and a subtle encouragement to boisterous activities.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Grub
node.description: From behind a large counter with a glass display full of meats, the sizzling sounds of a skillet can be heard. A series of tables in the area are laden with various baked and cooked goods, their scents wafting through the air of the tall tent.

node.name: Togs for Togs, Goods
node.description: Cleanly swept, the area on this side of the tent appears very orderly and well put together. Arranged to produce maximum space for browsing customers, several surfaces display a myriad of wares for sale.

node.name: Stomper's Corner, Showroom
node.description: Other than its vivid green hue and a rather generous overhead clearance, this tent is unremarkable. Although available to all comers, the goods for sale here clearly reflect Toggish enthusiasms.
